mdRecord.dcterms:title: Spring lancet in case
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Wiegand & Snowden [manufacturer]
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Brass spring lancet in red velvet-lined box with gold embossing; lancet marked WIEGAND & SNOWDEN; this piece has a common form of depth gauge designed to raise and lower a bar that would rest against the patient's skin prior to firing the lancet, however, the gauge on this item is missing a screw. [original]
Photographed by Claude Moore Health Sciences Library, Historical Collections and Services staff. [original]
Donated by Professor & Mrs. Ralph J. Stoudt, Jr. in honor of Elizabeth Heinrich Johnson Thomson, the grandmother of Professor Stoudt [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Medical instruments and apparatus--Phlebotomy
